author: Mollie Russell
description:
Board game publisher Czech Games Edition has called for “care, empathy, and respect” after it received criticism for announcing a new Harry Potter board game spin-off. Harry Potter is the creation of 'gender critical' campaigner J.K. Rowling, who presumably profits from licensed board games such as Czech’s Codenames: Back to Hogwarts. The statement posted on July 25 has not quelled criticism, however, with fans online now accusing the publisher of blocking social media users who call out the company.

Continue reading Czech Games Edition asks for "empathy" amid Harry Patter board game backlash
MORE FROM WARGAMER: Best board games , Couples' board games, Board games for adults
title: Czech Games Edition asks for "empathy" amid Harry Patter board game backlash

author: Matt Bassil
description:
The next Star Wars Unlimited set is getting cerebral. It’s time to hang up your blaster, bury your lightsaber, and swot up on your speechwriting skills, because Secrets of Power is all about skulduggery and political plots.

Continue reading The next Star Wars Unlimited TCG set is getting political, and I'm here for it

title: The next Star Wars Unlimited TCG set is getting political, and I'm here for it

author: Matt Bassil
description:
The new Pokémon Pocket set releases on July 30, and with it comes a frightening new Eeveelution. This set is themed around Johto and gives new ex cards to the psychic type Espeon and dark type Umbreon, two Pokémon which made their debut in the Gold and Silver games.

Continue reading Pokémon Pocket's new Umbreon ex has what we fear most: built-in Cyrus
MORE FROM WARGAMER: How many Pokémon are there?, How to play Pokémon cards, Rare Pokémon cards
title: Pokémon Pocket's new Umbreon ex has what we fear most: built-in Cyrus

author: Alex Evans
description:
In a completely unimportant and inconsequential business move that affects nobody, Games Workshop has finally started adopting its sleek, modern, new company logo on corporate websites. This elegant and professional block of sans serif capitals makes GW fit for its bright future as a high flying multinational firm, replacing a pokey, old fashioned red-yellow-black wordmark from the 1980s. It's the natural conclusion of a rebrand that started years ago, intended to make Warhammer the public face, and GW the boring corporate backend. And it's completely fine, really. I don't mind at all.

Continue reading Warhammer's dreary new Games Workshop logo is fine, and I'm totally fine, OK?
MORE FROM WARGAMER: Best Warhammer 40k starter sets,
title: Warhammer's dreary new Games Workshop logo is fine, and I'm totally fine, OK?

author: Mollie Russell
description:
Journeys Through the Radiant Citadel, a DnD adventure anthology inspired by BIPOC cultures, is currently 27% off at Amazon. This is a collection of dazzling, narratively complex one shots that take place in vibrant and varied settings. One moment you’re battling horrors in a setting inspired by the Southern bayou, and another you’re facing deep political intrigue in a city that harkens back to ancient Persia.

Continue reading My all-time favorite DnD adventure anthology is 27% off at Amazon right now
MORE FROM WARGAMER: DnD 2024 Player's Handbook review, DnD classes guide, DnD races guide
title: My all-time favorite DnD adventure anthology is 27% off at Amazon right now

author: Matt Bassil
description:
The Magic: The Gathering card Harabaz Druid has seen a very rapid and pretty large price spike, shooting from $2.30 to $12.80 in just a day or two - a rise of 456%.
